5B7F5219120F4315A61EDC6A9BFA6099.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

23F31FC02B6C47DFA59F775A72B43E1F.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

5A610222B373481E98B7D15B15FB2332.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

B45B0CA5CF6B4CB6A99A9FD710AF321D.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

83E4FE1BDA494CADA3BF9E486D219E77.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

ACD0C7E6767640EBA77DA3C7ED6A9ECD.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

2BFD861EFEB64384A9EF28F46FA8117C.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

B091948E1C3B48009A2EF3F03496D779.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

F7045ADF5D074A338B69A631A1B9985D.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

9253AEB46962477EBA085D4D20AC3480.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

91A9482FAF3548028F50635EA174001E.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

4D8ABBE8D48846B6A013E99E8F274BEF.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

066E728E821B4CA0BC3B651025A30C96.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

DBC90DFDCB684FB7A4D3B8771A6E3ADE.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: • What is my schedule of work hours? • Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative? Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?,  What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

DC422EE327934788B1708462066D0DD2.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

CE90BBCDC5254868919DC86CB4FFD4C7.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; • guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

69593285C10B47E78EA731ADDD25B4DC.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

EC5BF80BE26948D990C58163FD2BCEE5.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

76541CDBD7754B8B937E1224D5C89949.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

4365A449BDA547CC847AD0C2B18534CC.description: Discuss how economic conditions may affect job prospects in the financial industry.

39B3830879054757A0E9BB78A5658067.description: Reflect upon one’s suitability or non-suitability for a specific occupation in the financial industry

7DC7A34332884D41A375E94D4F78F37E.description: Research a variety of occupations in the financial industry using criteria such as: educational requirements; working conditions, including typical hours and shifts worked as well as typical locations; duties and skills required; physical, mental and emotional stresses; other occupations with which they interact; initial and ongoing educational requirements; professional, registration and/or licensing requirements in Saskatchewan and Canada; and, anticipated remuneration

C16FD5CD28B748439023BE04B82A5DCD.description: Identify occupations in the financial industry.

D4B7E2867E054DE7B89821335DB66026.description: Investigate career opportunities in the financial industry in Saskatchewan and Canada.

8DEA3CDCD8EE4307B476C070EA888FB0.description: Career Opportunities in the Financial Industry (Core)

976069F9CF2F47738EEECD2A4164EE9A.description: Critique financial institutions’ or companies’ sales tactics and claims that appear to be misleading.

EA08D3B4C76A4EADBE3A36F4165153BF.description: Investigate actions that should be taken when one becomes a victim of frauds, phishing or scams, including the process for reporting to authorities.

02690803A3C048BFA471701975AE5D84.description: Describe ways to protect oneself from frauds, phishing and scams such as an unsolicited vacation offer, unsolicited offer for computer repair services, or unsolicited request to confirm login details to a secure website.

C20494A9B7314BDB9A91CEBE0C5AC206.description: Examine the steps that should be followed if personal information has been compromised.

ABDC42D694CA4E3EA63E814E34ADBEE1.description: Research the financial and other (e.g., emotional) impact of frauds, phishing and scams on individuals and society.

80E3D3B2B44445F990E5BE2D2609236D.description: Discuss examples of frauds, phishing and scams that pose financial risks.

2CC2B7A62DD64BA2913C1B0FDA25DAFD.description: Explore the financial risks associated with frauds, phishing and scams.

BA00A347C35E40A9B26967D9F590174C.description: Reflect on the work of various registered charities or non-profit organizations and how their work aligns with one’s personal, cultural and/or religious values.

8E2B63CA8DD7427ABBF7DDE811DED59A.description: Examine the impact of one’s donation of resources (e.g., time, money and goods) to a registered charity, non-profit organization or worthy cause.

D034F4B6C65940058CF7883E40EDF70F.description: Evaluate how registered charities, non-profit organizations and worthy causes such as GoFundMe campaigns use donations to redistribute wealth for the common good.

03453DE0632A44A8971EF97516EE9864.description: Examine the work of registered charities, non-profit organizations and worthy causes.

9EE5827357DC4A5FA47621F12274419A.description: Investing in Registered Charities, Non-Profit Organizations and Worthy Causes (Optional)

282A574C7038473C9A09568FAF605118.description: Investigate the practice of philanthropy in other areas of the world including Asia and the Middle East.

2C70AB8AD9A6486A9E5D34855A9B0593.description: Investigate the work and impact of philanthropic initiatives locally, nationally and globally.

78B5CE1821084ACFB47A4B091362942D.description: Discuss ways other than contributing financially (e.g., volunteering one’s time or talents) to give to a registered charity, non-profit organization or worthy cause that do not include finances.

8A05D1BAAEAA45DBBB1EC064C0E826AC.description: Examine personal (e.g., helping to culturally evolve one’s community, providing a sense of purpose, being ethically responsible and giving back) and financial reasons (e.g., tax benefits) for donating to charities, nonprofit organizations and worthy causes.

BAE1A0E4F4934ACDAD3E3DEDD017B090.description: Research and describe charitable tax credits in Canada.

B164774156564086813857EFAC87E79D.description: Differentiate between a registered charity, non-profit organization and worthy cause such as a GoFundMe campaign.

3C399821CEE541C7BBC08BF0F69C1C87.description: Explore giving to registered charities, non-profit organizations and worthy causes as part of one’s financial plan.

E07E782EA40C46709BEBF425CE035889.description: Research how insurance companies make money.

5A24AC6AD5A84EE8A3AA382F30701572.description: Investigate how insurance minimizes the potential impact of financial loss for individuals.

55E7C4D24CBD47E9869680E121FEA187.description: Compare the types and costs of insurance available in Saskatchewan to what is available in other Canadian provinces.

417FEE03E62C42E0B52C340EABA6AF8A.description: Investigate costs of insurance and factors (e.g., aging and number of claims) that can impact those costs over time.

56D69D45725245609E14688F02B0E875.description: Identify types of insurance (e.g., tenant, house, auto, travel, life, disability, medical, dental, mortgage and income protection) available to individuals in Saskatchewan.

DF72EA771A694270A85083AB6095977C.description: Explore the importance of protection against potential financial loss.

E68D21130DF543CF9B41901F872DEB60.description: Examine cultural and/or religious attitudes and beliefs (e.g., Islamic views of interest and investment opportunities) towards investment income.

F638376E375D484AA5D6B0D49ED6BED3.description: Research where (e.g., prospectus, Fund Facts, Globe Fund, and SEDAR.com) to find fund, stock and general market data.

9330CBDDED524AACB723418ABFE51791.description: Research the advantages and disadvantages of a variety of ways to invest (e.g., through a registrant, through an online discount broker and day trading).

88B2DA9B1A5249C794DF9CE207492A09.description: Apply the Rule of 72 to estimate the growth in value of various investments.

79425B8A1ECB459CA571AD0D71B8D08B.description: Analyze different investment options such as savings accounts, stocks, bonds, Guaranteed Investment Certificates (GICs), mutual funds, index funds, derivatives, Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs), real estate, collectibles and/or business ownership.

DFB90D4622374200B89708ED9692F95B.description: Explain the relationship between saving and investing.

3B36D9608BCE4D2E86066D7349499290.description: Calculate the total cost of ownership for a variety of cell phone contracts from a variety of cell phone providers and with varying conditions (e.g., free phone with a contract for a minimum number of years, option to purchase the phone outright and monthly instalment payment plan for the phone).

E74C90D87E3D4AE38DAB6444019FC1C2.description: Differentiate among cell phone contracts, prepaid and pay-as-you-go cell phone services.

7E28FB88079B43D2AFEB01C5487A5434.description: Research where (e.g., Consumer Protection Division of the Financial and Consumer Affairs Authority) Saskatchewan consumers can get help when a collection agency or lender is perceived to have acted unfairly or illegally.

7BCF7EA89455415791C5B446885EFBAA.description: Research protection provided to debtors by the Saskatchewan Limitations Act, 2004.

1F49393A119D444D94C91EA148AE3E77.description: Investigate conditions necessary for debt to be sent to debt collection and how this might affect one’s future access to credit.

B0BABACADB9E454BB71BB27AC55B1BB5.description: Investigate ways to manage one’s debt including consolidation of loans.

B8B387E7D79A4FBFBA8DD3212EF982A4.description: Discuss reasons why the debt to income ratio might vary from one area of the country to another.

8EE87967CF614C3EA0739B1BE662D83F.description: Examine factors that could lead to a breach of contract and the potential resulting consequences

B1A7FE7C32AB4442BB5A258780EB4FFD.description: Discuss how a salesperson of goods and services is paid (e.g., commission and salary/wage) and the how marketing psychology may influence the sales tactics used to secure financial contracts

58DC153C698A481191F52DDF66971395.description: Provide examples of common financial contracts for goods and services such as cell phones, gaming program purchases and related electronic devices, vehicles, credit cards, warranties, housing, lines of credit and loans.

34B7E4ECAA524C36AF7623963C674868.description: Examine the components and legalities of financial contracts.

9046FC06C84048BD8CCB7FA3C97F81ED.description: Identify the steps necessary to report and correct mistakes on a credit card statement

328CD9ABD2D745518E3485A64EEBAA3C.description: Analyze credit card statements to understand the main components such as: charges; payments; interest; minimum payment amount;  minimum payment warning; and, balances

2F5A7C94E60746D48831D13F250816B9.description: Explore the advantages and disadvantages associated with each type of payment card.

7A197BE8B91C40088C0379FE13A27E9A.description: Discuss how students may gain access to various types of payment cards

5935EE3F17184077B9C6F9D390E5C87D.description: Investigate different types of payment cards.

2896B60A9CD0445A8B163BEEB4243AE1.description: Discuss the impact that access to credit has on one’s lifestyle choices and resulting short- and long-term consequences.
